column4: I'm trying to boot from cd; how come there is no option to 'start ubuntu or install from disk'. The only option is 'install to the hard disk'?
do u have the livecd or alternate cd?
I didn't hit the checkbox for the alternate cd... i just downloaded the default
so i assume that's the livecd?
you should doublecheck the iso you burned
is there any way to check whether it's the live cd by looking at the files on the cd?
dont have the iso atm,sorry
and can you also check if you've d/l the desktop edn not the server one
i have the 64-bit server edition; there is no livecd for server?
server edn does not run the gui
oic, that's right. i installed the gui separately. well, thanks
what is ur HDD?
wd740
western digital wd740 raptor
but gparted detects correctly when i'm running ubuntu server from disk
check it out http://www.sysresccd.org/
ok
I will try the system rescue cd. it doesn't make sense to me why gparted running off disk would detect the hdd correctly but gparted running off live cd wouldn't. different versions maybe?
could be.  hope it works
tnx
sys recovery cd worked! thanks!
